It seems to happen consistently with jpgs I export from photoshop.</p>\n<p>Is there any way I can specify in my ffmpeg command to keep the same resolution of my image and not to stretch it?</p>\n<p>My function below:</p>\n<pre><code>async function debugFunction() {\n    console.log('debugFunction()')\n    //begin setting up ffmpeg\n    const ffmpeg = require('fluent-ffmpeg');\n    //Get the paths to the packaged versions of the binaries we want to use\n    var ffmpegPath = require('ffmpeg-static-electron').path;\n    ffmpegPath = ffmpegPath.replace('app.asar', 'app.asar.unpacked')\n    var ffprobePath = require('ffprobe-static-electron').path;\n    ffprobePath = ffprobePath.replace('app.asar', 'app.asar.unpacked')\n    //tell the ffmpeg package where it can find the needed binaries.\n    ffmpeg.setFfmpegPath(ffmpegPath);\n    ffmpeg.setFfprobePath(ffprobePath);\n    //end setting ffmpeg\n\n    let imgPath = &quot;C:\\\\Users\\\\marti\\\\Documents\\\\martinradio\\\\image.jpg&quot;;\n    let audioPath = &quot;C:\\\\Users\\\\marti\\\\Documents\\\\martinradio\\\\audio.mp3&quot;;\n    let vidPath = &quot;C:\\\\Users\\\\marti\\\\Documents\\\\martinradio\\\\video.mp4&quot;;\n\n    //create ffmpeg command\n    ffmpeg()\n    //set rendering options\n    .input(imgPath)\n    .loop()\n    .addInputOption('-framerate 2')\n    .input(audioPath)\n    .videoCodec('libx264')\n    .audioCodec('copy')\n    .audioBitrate('320k')\n    .videoBitrate('8000k', true)\n    .size('1920x1080')\n    .outputOptions([\n        '-preset medium',\n        '-tune stillimage',\n        '-crf 18',\n        '-pix_fmt yuv420p',\n        '-shortest'\n    ])\n    //set status events\n    .on('progress', function (progress) {\n        if (progress.percent) {\n            console.log(`Rendering: ${progress.percent}% done`)\n        }\n    })\n    .on('codecData', function (data) {\n        console.log('codecData=', data);\n    })\n    .on('end', function () {\n        console.log('Video has been converted succesfully');\n    })\n    .on('error', function (err) {\n        console.log('errer rendering video: ' + err.message);\n    })\n    //run ffmpeg command\n    .output(vidPath).run()\n\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>renders successfully if I give it an audio file and this image:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/wz4Hy.jpg\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img {"body":"<p>my blog is looking fine in the desktop version, but when I load it on the mobile, the margin and padding for the individual posts and the list of posts on homepage are disappearing. I've found that the problem is because of the Light/Dark mode theme widget I've added. When I remove the script from that widget, the margins and padding are working as they should.</p>\n<p>Another strange thing is that instead of deleting the script, if I just switch the nightmode on once and reload the page, the margins and padding are working as they should, even after switching the night mode off. Though, this doesn't work once I delete the cache, so the problem must probably be with the script or the CSS.</p>\n<p>I've found no problem in the CSS of that widget, and the console isn't throwing any errors either, but I'm posting both the script and the CSS below. I think the problem is with the <strong>'.section_center'</strong> class that's editing the CSS, but I'm not sure how it's affecting the page because there's no such class declared anywhere in the first place. I've tried replacing it with the '.body' class and also fiddled with the <em>display</em> attribute, but that didn't change much. I'm quite lost here. \n$(document).ready(function(){$(&quot;body&quot;).toggleClass(localStorage.toggled),$(&quot;#modedark&quot;).on(&quot;click&quot;,function(){&quot;nightmode&quot;!=localStorage.toggled?($(&quot;body&quot;).toggleClass(&quot;nightmode&quot;,!0),localStorage.toggled=&quot;nightmode&quot;,$(&quot;.section-center&quot;).css(&quot;display&quot;,&quot;block&quot;)):($(&quot;body&quot;).toggleClass(&quot;nightmode&quot;,!1),localStorage.toggled=&quot;&quot;,$(&quot;.section-center&quot;).css(&quot;display&quot;,&quot;&quot;))}),$(&quot;body&quot;).hasClass(&quot;nightmode&quot;)?$(&quot;#modedark&quot;).prop(&quot;checked&quot;,!0):$(&quot;#modedark&quot;).prop(&quot;checked&quot;,!1)}); {"body":"<p>JavaScript has no problem, it sees an anonymous arrow function and it's <code>.toString()</code> method returns exactly that.</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>// This returns as expected\n// ie `() =&gt; \"\"`\nconst t = [() =&gt; \"\"];\nconsole.log(t[0].toString());</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>This example uses Babel, but the same happens in TypeScript. TypeScript sees an anonymous arrow function and tries to create an anonymous function statement which is invalid if trying to run <code>eval</code> on it.</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"true\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>// This returns an incomplete function string\nconst t = [() =&gt; \"\"]\nconsole.log(t[0].toString());</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>Running <code>eval(t[0].toString())</code> will return error:</p>\n<pre><code>SyntaxError: Function statements require a function name\n</code></pre>\n<p>Is there a way to preserve the correct syntax when using Babel/TypeScript? {"body":"<p>I want to convert the following data structure:</p>\n<pre><code>const data = [\n  {\n    regions: ['United States', 'Canada']\n  },\n  {\n    regions: ['United States']\n  },\n  {\n    prop1: {\n      regions: ['Canada']\n    }\n  },\n  {\n    prop2: [\n      {\n        regions: ['Mexico', 'United States'],\n        prop3: {\n          regions: ['Canada']\n        }\n      }\n    ]\n  }\n];\n</code></pre>\n<p>into the following data structure:</p>\n<pre><code>['United States', 'Canada', 'United States', 'Canada', 'Mexico', 'United States', 'Canada']\n</code></pre>\n<p>I'm looking to do this with ES6 using <code>.reduce</code> and <code>.map</code> recursively to be safe.</p>\n<p>This is what i've tried so far but it only goes 2 levels deep:</p>\n<pre><code>export const flattenArray = (arr: Object[], prop: string): any[] =&gt;\n  arr.reduce(\n    (a, c) =&gt; [\n      ...new Set([\n        ...a,\n        ...c.map(x =&gt; x[prop]).reduce((y, z) =&gt; [...y, ...z.map(j =&gt; j)], []),\n      ]),\n    ],\n    []\n  );\n</code></pre>\n<p>UPDATE: I've wen't with @deterjan and his solution below. Incase anyone needs a non <code>.flat</code> version this is his solution in a single function with <code>.reduce</code></p>\n<pre><code>export const flatten = (obj: any, prop: string): any[] =&gt; [\n  ...new Set(\n    Object.keys(obj).reduce((a, c) =&gt; {\n      if (c === prop) {\n        if (isArray(obj[prop])) {\n          return [...a, ...obj[c]];\n        } else {\n          return [...a, obj[c]];\n        }\n      } else if (isArray(obj[c])) {\n        return [\n          ...a,\n          ...obj[c].reduce((a, c) =&gt; [...a, ...flatten(c, prop)], []),\n        ];\n      } else if (isObject(obj)) {\n        return [...a, ...flatten(obj[c], prop)];\n      } else {\n        return a;\n      }\n    }, [])\n  ),\n];\n\nconsole.log(flatten(data, 'regions'));\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":626,"question_id":64938307,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>EDIT: after checking Brian's answer, I found out that even in the 2nd example, removing <code>...state</code> would cause the same behaviour as the 1st example, so this question was wrong to ask. I'm not sure what made see the wrong behaviour and apologize for any inconvenience caused. Brian's answer is a good explanation of the use.</p>\n<p>Compare the following 2 code snippets, they do the same thing by both updating 2 states at once with an <code>initialState</code>, except one uses <code>useState</code> and the other one uses <code>useReducer</code>:</p>\n<ol>\n<li><code>useState</code></li>\n</ol>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"true\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const {useState} = React;\n\nconst initialState = {\n  name: 'John',\n  age: 20\n};\n\nconst Example = () =&gt; {\n  const [state, setState] = useState(initialState);\n\n  const handleName = () =&gt; {\n    setState({...state, name: 'Tom'});\n  }\n  \n  const handleAge = () =&gt; {\n    setState({...state, age: 30});\n  }\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div&gt;\n      &lt;p&gt;{state.name}&lt;/p&gt;\n      &lt;p&gt;{state.age}&lt;/p&gt;\n      &lt;button onClick={handleName}&gt;\n        Click to change name\n      &lt;/button&gt;\n      &lt;button onClick={handleAge}&gt;\n        Click to change age\n       &lt;/button&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  );\n};\n\nReactDOM.render(\n  &lt;Example /&gt;,\n  document.getElementById(\"react\")\n);</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react/16.8.4/umd/react.production.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react-dom/16.8.4/umd/react-dom.production.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;div id=\"react\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<ol start=\"2\">\n<li><code>useReducer</code></li>\n</ol>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"true\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const {useReducer} = React;\n\nconst initialState = {\n    name: 'Tom',\n    age: 30\n}\nconst reducer = (state, action) =&gt; {\n    switch (action.type) {\n        case 'name':\n            return {\n                ...state,\n                name: 'John'\n            }\n        case 'age':\n            return {\n                ...state,\n                age: 25\n            }\n        default:\n            return state\n    }\n}\n\nconst Example = () =&gt; {\n  const [state, dispatch] = useReducer(reducer, initialState);\n    return (\n        &lt;div&gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;Name: {state.name}&lt;/p&gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;Age: {state.age}&lt;/p&gt;\n            &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; dispatch({ type: 'name' })}&gt;Click to update name&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; dispatch({ type: 'age' })}&gt;Click to update age&lt;/button&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n    )\n};\n\nReactDOM.render(\n  &lt;Example /&gt;,\n  document.getElementById(\"react\")\n);</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react/16.8.4/umd/react.production.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react-dom/16.8.4/umd/react-dom.production.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;div id=\"react\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>If removing <code>...state</code> in the first example, it sets the state to a single key/value pair thus no longer works. I was expecting the same thing to happen in the second example, but it didn't. the second example works well with the spread operator removed.</p>\n<p>I have 3 questions for the 2nd example:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>what is the use of the spread operator?</li>\n<li>why does it still work after removing the spread operators?</li>\n<li>If it works well without the spread operator, does that mean the spread operator is not needed in the 2nd example?</li>\n</ol>\n","userId":1,"threadId":642,"question_id":64937984,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>im writing a request to REST Countries using cURL and AJAX:</p>\n<p>html :</p>\n<pre><code>    &lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html lang=&quot;en&quot;&gt;\n&lt;head&gt;\n    &lt;meta charset=&quot;UTF-8&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;meta name=&quot;viewport&quot; 'lat=' . $_REQUEST['lat'] . '&amp;lng=' . $_REQUEST['lng'] . '&amp;username=warchlock';\n$url = 'https://restcountries.eu/rest/v2/alpha/' . $_REQUEST['iso2'];\n$ch = curl_init();\ncurl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);\ncurl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);\ncurl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);\n\n$result = curl_exec($ch);\n\ncurl_close($ch);\necho $result;\n$decode = json_decode($result, true);\n\n$output['status']['code'] = &quot;200&quot;;\n$output['status']['name'] = &quot;ok&quot;;\n\n\n$output['data'] = $decode['name'];\n\nheader('Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8');\n\necho json_encode($output);\n</code></pre>\n<p>For some reason value from select is not passed and Im getting a 'bad request' response. interval: false,\n  })\n\n  $(document).ready(function(){\n    $('#phone').mask('+48 000 000 000');\n    $('#zipcode').mask('00-000');\n  });\n\n  let formResult = {\n    name:&quot;&quot;,\n    lastname:&quot;&quot;,\n    email:&quot;&quot;,\n    wantCaffeSet:true,\n    rules:false,\n    whereDelivery:&quot;office&quot;,\n    phone:&quot;&quot;,\n    adress:&quot;&quot;,\n    zipcode:&quot;&quot;,\n    city:&quot;&quot;,\n    rulesTwo:false,\n    formSendCodes: &quot;true&quot;\n  }\n\n  class MainFormInputs {\n    constructor(){\n      const mainInputs = document.querySelectorAll(&quot;.form__mainInput&quot;);\n      const checkboxInput = document.querySelector(&quot;.form__mainCheckbox&quot;);\n      const checkBoxInout2 = document.querySelector(&quot;.form__mainCheckbox2&quot;);\n\n      mainInputs.forEach((input)=&gt;{\n        input.addEventListener(&quot;keyup&quot;, (e)=&gt; this.inputsValidateFunc(e));\n      })\n\n      checkboxInput.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, (e)=&gt; this.checkboxValidateFunc(e));\n      checkBoxInout2.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, (e)=&gt; this.checkboxTwoValidateFunc(e));\n    }\n\n    inputsValidateFunc = (e) =&gt; {\n      const targetValue = e.target.value;\n      const targetName = e.target.name;\n      const patternEmail = /^[\\w-\\.]+@([\\w-]+\\.)+[\\w-]{2,4}$/;\n      const patternZipcode = /^([0-9]{2})-([0-9]{3})$/;\n\n      if(targetName === &quot;name&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &gt; 1) formResult.name = targetValue;\n      else if(targetName === &quot;name&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &lt; 2) formResult.name = &quot;&quot;;\n\n      if(targetName === &quot;lastname&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &gt; 1) formResult.lastname = targetValue;\n      else if(targetName === &quot;lastname&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &lt; 2) formResult.lastname = &quot;&quot;;\n\n      if(targetName === &quot;email&quot; &amp;&amp; patternEmail.test(targetValue)) formResult.email = targetValue;\n      else if(targetName === &quot;email&quot; &amp;&amp; !patternEmail.test(targetValue)) formResult.email = &quot;&quot;;\n\n      //SECOND FORM INPUTS\n      if(targetName === &quot;phone&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &gt; 14) formResult.phone = targetValue;\n      else if(targetName === &quot;phone&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &lt; 15) formResult.phone = &quot;&quot;;\n\n      if(targetName === &quot;adress&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &gt; 1) formResult.adress = targetValue;\n      else if(targetName === &quot;adress&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &lt; 2) formResult.adress = &quot;&quot;;\n\n      if(targetName === &quot;zipcode&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &gt; 1 &amp;&amp; patternZipcode.test(targetValue)) formResult.zipcode = targetValue;\n      else if(targetName === &quot;zipcode&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &lt; 2 || targetName === &quot;zipcode&quot; &amp;&amp; !patternZipcode.test(targetValue)) formResult.zipcode = &quot;&quot;;\n\n      if(targetName === &quot;city&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &gt; 1) formResult.city = targetValue;\n      else if(targetName === &quot;city&quot; &amp;&amp; targetValue.length &lt; 2) formResult.city = &quot;&quot;;\n      \n\n      //Validate during type\n      const submitButton = document.querySelector(&quot;.form__next&quot;);\n      if(formResult.name &amp;&amp; formResult.lastname &amp;&amp; formResult.email &amp;&amp; formResult.rules){\n        submitButton.style.pointerEvents = &quot;initial&quot;\n      }else{\n        submitButton.style.pointerEvents = &quot;none&quot;\n      }\n\n\n        //SECOND FORM VALIDATE\n        const submitOrderButton = document.querySelector(&quot;.form__submitBtn&quot;);\n        if(formResult.whereDelivery === &quot;home&quot;){\n          if(formResult.phone &amp;&amp; formResult.adress &amp;&amp; formResult.zipcode &amp;&amp; formResult.city &amp;&amp; formResult.rulesTwo){\n            submitOrderButton.style.pointerEvents = 'initial';\n          }else{\n            submitOrderButton.style.pointerEvents = 'none';\n          }\n        }else{\n          submitOrderButton.style.pointerEvents = 'initial';\n        }\n    }\n\n    checkboxValidateFunc = (e) =&gt;{\n      formResult.rules = e.target.checked;\n    }\n\n    checkboxTwoValidateFunc = (e) =&gt;{\n      formResult.rulesTwo = e.target.checked;\n    }\n  }\n\n\n  class RadioButton{\n    constructor(){\n    const radioButtonYes = document.querySelector(&quot;.radio_btnYes&quot;);\n    const radioButtonNo = document.querySelector(&quot;.radio_btnNo&quot;);\n\n    const radioButtonOffice = document.querySelector(&quot;.radio__btnOffice&quot;);\n    const radioButtonHome = document.querySelector(&quot;.radio__btnHome&quot;);\n\n    radioButtonYes.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, ()=&gt; this.radioMainFormFunc(radioButtonYes,radioButtonNo,&quot;YES&quot;));\n    radioButtonNo.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, ()=&gt; this.radioMainFormFunc(radioButtonYes,radioButtonNo,&quot;NO&quot;));\n\n    radioButtonOffice.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, ()=&gt; this.radioSecondFormFunc(radioButtonOffice,radioButtonHome,&quot;OFFICE&quot;));\n    radioButtonHome.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, ()=&gt; this.radioSecondFormFunc(radioButtonOffice,radioButtonHome,&quot;HOME&quot;));\n    }\n\n\n    radioMainFormFunc = (radioYes,radioNo, whichRadio) =&gt; {\n      if(whichRadio === &quot;YES&quot;){\n        radioYes.children[0].classList.add(&quot;radio__btnInner--checked&quot;);\n        radioNo.children[0].classList.remove(&quot;radio__btnInner--checked&quot;);\n        formResult.wantCaffeSet=true;\n      }else{\n        radioYes.children[0].classList.remove(&quot;radio__btnInner--checked&quot;);\n        radioNo.children[0].classList.add(&quot;radio__btnInner--checked&quot;);\n        formResult.wantCaffeSet=false;\n      }\n    }\n\n\n    radioSecondFormFunc = (radioOffice,radioHome, whichRadio) =&gt; {\n      const formSecondInputs = document.querySelectorAll(&quot;.form__mainSecondInput&quot;);\n\n      if(whichRadio === &quot;OFFICE&quot;){\n        radioOffice.children[0].classList.add(&quot;radio__btnInner--checked&quot;);\n        radioHome.children[0].classList.remove(&quot;radio__btnInner--checked&quot;);\n        formResult.whereDelivery=&quot;office&quot;\n\n        const formErrors = document.querySelectorAll('.form__error');\n        formErrors.forEach((error)=&gt;{\n          error.style.display = &quot;none&quot;;\n        })\n\n        formSecondInputs.forEach((input)=&gt;{\n          input.style.display = &quot;none&quot;\n          input.style.border = &quot;1px solid #ced4da&quot;\n        \n        })\n\n      }else{\n        radioOffice.children[0].classList.remove(&quot;radio__btnInner--checked&quot;);\n        radioHome.children[0].classList.add(&quot;radio__btnInner--checked&quot;);\n        formResult.whereDelivery=&quot;home&quot;\n\n        formSecondInputs.forEach((input)=&gt;{\n          input.style.display = &quot;flex&quot;\n        })\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n\n  class MainFormSubmit{\n      constructor(){\n        this.wrongInputsBorder = &quot;&quot;;\n        this.correctInputsBorder = &quot;&quot;;\n        const mainForm = document.getElementById(&quot;mainForm&quot;);\n        const mainFormSecond = document.querySelector(&quot;.formSecondPart&quot;);\n\n        const submitButton = document.querySelector(&quot;.form__next&quot;);\n        const submitButtonContainer = document.querySelector(&quot;.form__nextContainer&quot;);\n\n        const submitOrderButton = document.querySelector(&quot;.form__submitBtn&quot;);\n        const submitOrderButtonContainer = document.querySelector(&quot;.form__orderContainer&quot;);\n\n        mainForm.addEventListener(&quot;mouseover&quot;, ()=&gt; this.validateFormFunc(submitButton,submitOrderButton));\n        mainFormSecond.addEventListener(&quot;mouseover&quot;, ()=&gt; this.validateFormFunc(submitButton,submitOrderButton));\n\n        submitButtonContainer .addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, ()=&gt; this.clickRejectedFunc(submitButtonContainer));\n        submitOrderButtonContainer .addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, ()=&gt; this.clickRejectedSecondFormFunc(submitOrderButtonContainer));\n\n        submitOrderButton.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, ()=&gt; this.sendFormResultFunc());\n      }\n\n\n      validateFormFunc = (submitButton,submitOrderButton) =&gt; {\n        if(formResult.wantCaffeSet &amp;&amp; formResult.name &amp;&amp; formResult.lastname &amp;&amp; formResult.email &amp;&amp; formResult.rules){\n          submitButton.style.pointerEvents = 'initial';\n        }else{\n          submitButton.style.pointerEvents = 'none';\n        }\n\n        //SECOND FORM VALIDATE\n        if(formResult.whereDelivery === &quot;home&quot;){\n          if(formResult.phone &amp;&amp; formResult.adress &amp;&amp; formResult.zipcode &amp;&amp; formResult.city &amp;&amp; formResult.rulesTwo){\n            submitOrderButton.style.pointerEvents = 'initial';\n          }else{\n            submitOrderButton.style.pointerEvents = 'none';\n          }\n        }else{\n          submitOrderButton.style.pointerEvents = 'initial';\n        }\n      }\n\n      clickRejectedFunc = (submitButtonContainer) =&gt; {\n        const name = document.getElementById(&quot;name&quot;);\n        const lastname = document.getElementById(&quot;lastname&quot;);\n        const email= document.getElementById(&quot;email&quot;);\n\n        if(!formResult.name){\n          name.style.border =&quot;1px solid #f00&quot;;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__nameError&quot;).style.display = &quot;initial&quot;;\n        } else{\n          name.style.border = &quot;1px solid rgb(29, 129, 29)&quot;;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__nameError&quot;).style.display = &quot;none&quot;;\n        } \n\n        if(!formResult.lastname){\n          lastname.style.border =&quot;1px solid #f00&quot;;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__lastnameError&quot;).style.display = &quot;initial&quot;;\n        } else{\n          lastname.style.border = &quot;1px solid rgb(29, 129, 29)&quot;;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__lastnameError&quot;).style.display = &quot;none&quot;;\n        } \n\n        if(!formResult.email){\n          email.style.border =&quot;1px solid #f00&quot;;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__emailError&quot;).style.display = &quot;initial&quot;;\n        } else{\n          email.style.border = &quot;1px solid rgb(29, 129, 29)&quot;;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__emailError&quot;).style.display = &quot;none&quot;;\n        } \n\n        if(!formResult.rules){\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__checkBoxText&quot;).style.color = &quot;#f00&quot;;\n        } else{\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__checkBoxText&quot;).style.color = &quot;#000&quot;;\n        } \n        \n        //If Only register to newsletter\n        if(!formResult.wantCaffeSet &amp;&amp; formResult.name &amp;&amp; formResult.lastname &amp;&amp; formResult.email &amp;&amp; formResult.rules){\n          // window.location.href = 'thanks';\n \n          \n          return\n        }\n\n        this.shakeButtonWhenWrong(formResult.name, formResult.lastname, formResult.email, formResult.rules, true, submitButtonContainer);\n      }\n\n      clickRejectedSecondFormFunc = (submitOrderButtonContainer ) =&gt; {\n        const phone= document.getElementById(&quot;phone&quot;);\n        const adress= document.getElementById(&quot;adress&quot;);\n        const zipcode= document.getElementById(&quot;zipcode&quot;);\n        const city= document.getElementById(&quot;city&quot;);\n\n        //SECOND FORM INPUTS\n        if(formResult.whereDelivery === &quot;home&quot;){\n\n        if(!formResult.phone){\n          phone.style.border =&quot;1px solid #f00&quot;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__phoneError&quot;).style.display = &quot;initial&quot;;\n        } else{\n          phone.style.border = &quot;1px solid rgb(29, 129, 29)&quot;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__phoneError&quot;).style.display = &quot;none&quot;;\n        } \n\n        if(!formResult.adress){\n          adress.style.border =&quot;1px solid #f00&quot;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__adressError&quot;).style.display = &quot;initial&quot;;\n        } else{\n          adress.style.border = &quot;1px solid rgb(29, 129, 29)&quot;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__adressError&quot;).style.display = &quot;none&quot;;\n        } \n\n        if(!formResult.zipcode){\n          zipcode.style.border =&quot;1px solid #f00&quot;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__zipcodeError&quot;).style.display = &quot;initial&quot;;\n        } else{\n          zipcode.style.border = &quot;1px solid rgb(29, 129, 29)&quot;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__zipcodeError&quot;).style.display = &quot;none&quot;;\n        } \n\n        if(!formResult.city){\n          city.style.border =&quot;1px solid #f00&quot;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__cityError&quot;).style.display = &quot;initial&quot;;\n        } else{\n          city.style.border = &quot;1px solid rgb(29, 129, 29)&quot;\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__cityError&quot;).style.display = &quot;none&quot;;\n        } \n\n        if(!formResult.rulesTwo){\n          document.querySelector(&quot;.form__checkBoxText2&quot;).style.color = &quot;#f00&quot;;\n        } else{\n formResult.city, formResult.rulesTwo, submitOrderButtonContainer);\n      }\n    }\n\n    shakeButtonWhenWrong = (form1, form2, form3, form4, form5, whichButon) =&gt; {\n      if(!form1 || !form2 || !form3 || !form4 || !form5){\n        whichButon.style.left = '-10%'\n         setTimeout(() =&gt; {\n          whichButon.style.left = '10%'\n        }, 50);\n        setTimeout(() =&gt; {\n {"body":"<p>Can't resize React Player Video.\nI change the width to any number and the video stays unchanged.\nI am trying to optimize it for computer view and then add breakpoints to resize for smaller screens like phones.</p>\n<pre><code>import React, { useContext, useEffect, useState } from 'react'\nimport { makeStyles } from '@material-ui/core/styles'\nimport Modal from '@material-ui/core/Modal'\nimport { MovieContext } from './MovieContext'\nimport ReactPlayer from 'react-player'\nimport { getTrailer } from '../utils/movieDB'\n// potential of adding controls\n// import { Slider, Direction } from 'react-player-controls'\n//slider to be implemented\n//https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-player-controls#playericon-\n\nconst useStyles = makeStyles((theme) =&gt; ({\n  video: {\n    width: 'auto',\n    height: 'auto',\n    top: '25%',\n    right: '25%',\n    position: 'fixed',\n    [theme.breakpoints.down('xs')]: {},\n  },\n}))\n\nconst styles = {\n  player: {\n    width: '300px',\n  },\n}\n\nexport default function SimpleModal({ open }) {\n  const classes = useStyles(),\n    //receives movie from Home &gt; DisplayCard &gt; MovieContext\n    { setOpenTrailer, movie, setMovie } = useContext(MovieContext),\n    [trailer, setTrailer] = useState(),\n    [key, setKey] = useState(),\n    [modalStyle] = useState()\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    if (movie) {\n      getTrailer(movie).then((data) =&gt; {\n        setKey(data.videos.results[0].key)\n        setTrailer(data)\n      })\n    }\n  }, [movie])\n\n  const handleOpen = () =&gt; {\n    setOpenTrailer(true)\n  }\n\n  const handleClose = () =&gt; {\n    setOpenTrailer(false)\n    setMovie(undefined)\n    setTrailer(undefined)\n    setKey(undefined)\n  }\n\n  const renderVideo = (\n    &lt;&gt;\n      {key &amp;&amp; (\n        &lt;div className={classes.video}&gt;\n          &lt;ReactPlayer style={styles.player} url={`https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=${key}`} /&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n      )}\n    &lt;/&gt;\n  )\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div&gt;\n      &lt;Modal\n        open={open || false}\n        onClose={handleClose}\n        aria-labelledby=&quot;simple-modal-title&quot;\n        aria-describedby=&quot;simple-modal-description&quot;\n      &gt;\n        {renderVideo}\n      &lt;/Modal&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Any suggestions on how to optimally set the width of the video to work nicely with phones and computers?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":651,"question_id":64937830,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>Given a Firebase Cloud Function, what's the proper way to fail an event (with the intention of retrying it) <strong>without causing a cold start</strong>?</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://firebase.google.com/docs/functions/reporting-errors\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">This documentation</a> suggests that unhandled errors cause cold starts. When using <code>async</code> functionality I'm assuming this applies to a rejected <code>Promise</code> as well.</p>\n<blockquote>\n<p>throw new Error('I failed you'); // Will cause a cold start if not caught</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p>Given that functions will often rely on third-party services that may not be 100% reliable, I don't want my functions to incur further penalties from cold starts due to transient downstream errors.</p>\n<p>Is this even a recommended strategy? I'm using Firestore so I've considered storing retryable events in a temp collection that is scraped by a scheduled cloud function, but this seems unnecessarily complex.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":652,"question_id":64937797,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I am trying to make a code editor using HTML:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html lang='en'&gt;\n&lt;head&gt;\n    &lt;meta charset='UTF-8'&gt;\n    &lt;meta http-equiv='X-UA-Compatible' content='IE=Edge'&gt;\n    &lt;meta name='viewport' content='width=device-width, initial-scale=1'&gt;\n    &lt;link rel='stylesheet' href='style.css'&gt;\n&lt;/head&gt;\n\n&lt;body&gt;\n    &lt;pre id='editor'&gt;&lt;code contenteditable='true'&gt;&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;\n    \n    &lt;script type='module'&gt;\n        import { highlight } from './highlighter.js';\n        import { Caret } from './caret.js';\n        (() =&gt;\n        {\n            const editor = document.querySelector('#editor code');\n            const caret = new Caret(editor);\n            highlight(editor);\n            editor.addEventListener('input', e =&gt;\n            {\n                highlight(editor);\n                e.preventDefault();\n            });\n            editor.addEventListener('keydown', e =&gt;\n            {\n                const TAB   = 9;\n                const ENTER = 13;\n                switch (e.keyCode)\n                {\n                    // ...\n                }\n            });\n        })();\n    &lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>highlighter.js:</p>\n<pre><code>import { Caret } from './caret.js';\nexport function highlight(editor)\n{\n    // ...\n    const NORM = '#E6E6FA';\n    // ...\n    const Highlighter = {\n        source: editor.innerText,\n        start: 0,\n        curr: 0,\n        // ...\n        fin()\n        {\n            return this.curr &gt;= this.source.length;\n        },\n        advance()\n        {\n            return this.source[this.curr++];\n        },\n        // ...\n        scan()\n        {\n            let result = '';\n            this.start = this.curr;\n            if (this.fin())\n            {\n                return null;\n            }\n            const char = this.advance();\n            let color = NORM;\n            switch (char)\n            {\n                // ...\n            }\n            return {\n                color,\n                text: this.source.substring(this.start, this.curr),\n            };\n        },\n    };\n    let result = '';\n    const caret = new Caret(editor);\n    const save = caret.getPos();\n    for (;;)\n    {\n        const lexeme = Highlighter.scan();\n        if (lexeme === null)\n        {\n            break;\n        }\n        const chars = lexeme.text.split('').map(\n            x =&gt; `&lt;span style='color: ${lexeme.color};'&gt;${x}&lt;/span&gt;`);\n        result += chars.join('');\n    }\n    editor.innerHTML = result;\n    caret.setPos(save);\n};\n</code></pre>\n<p>Basically, it takes the text content of the user's code, scans it to generate lexemes with color data, splits those lexemes into characters that are put into &lt;span&gt; tags with the colors, then appends those &lt;span&gt;s to a string that the innerHTML of the editor is updated to, and finally the user's cursor is put back to its proper position; this is done on input. There's one problem, though: if the user types too fast, their inputed text can be doubled. I've tried to remedy this with other types of event listeners, and tried simply using setInterval, but it hasn't worked well at all.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":655,"question_id":64937697,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{\n    setGame({\n      ...game_,\n      [e.target.name] : e.target.value\n    })\n  }\n\n  const handleSubmit = e =&gt; {\n    e.preventDefault()\n    let error = ''\n    const {title, imageUrl, id} = game_\n    if(!title || !imageUrl) {\n      error = 'Input can\\'t be empty'\n      setGame({errors: error}) \n      return\n    }\n    const newGame = {\n      \n      id,\n      title,\n      imageUrl \n    }\n\n    if(id){\n      gameEdit(_id, newGame)\n      setIsEditing(false)\n    }\n    else {\n      createGame(newGame)\n    setGame({\n      title : '',\n      imageUrl : ''\n    })\n    }\n    \n  }\n\n  \n\n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;container&quot;&gt;\n      {\n        game_.errors &amp;&amp; &lt;h4&gt;{game_.errors}&lt;/h4&gt;\n      }\n      &lt;form onSubmit={handleSubmit}&gt;\n        &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; placeholder=&quot;Enter Title&quot; name=&quot;title&quot; value={game_.title} onChange={handleChange} /&gt;\n        &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; placeholder=&quot;Enter Image Url&quot; name=&quot;imageUrl&quot; value={game_.imageUrl} onChange={handleChange} /&gt;\n    &lt;button&gt;{game_.id?(&lt;h4&gt;Edit&lt;/h4&gt;):(&lt;h4&gt;Create&lt;/h4&gt;)}&lt;/button&gt;\n      &lt;/form&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n\nexport default connect(null, {createGame, gameEdit})(GameForm)\n\n</code></pre>\n<pre><code>Redux Action\n\nexport const gameEdit = (id, game) =&gt; dispatch =&gt; {\n  const req = {\n    method : &quot;DELETE&quot;,\n    headers : {&quot;Content-Type&quot;:&quot;application/json&quot;},\n    body : JSON.stringify(game)\n  }\n \n  fetch(`http://127.0.0.1:8000/game/${id}`, req)\n   .then(res =&gt; res.json())\n   .then(data=&gt;dispatch({\n     type : GAME_EDIT,\n     payload : game\n   }))\n}\n</code></pre>\n<pre><code>Redux Reducer\n\nimport {GAME_DELETE, GAME_EDIT, GAME_ITEM, GAME_LIST, GAME_CREATE} from '../action/types'\n\nconst initialState = {\n  games : []\n}\n\nexport default function(state=initialState, action){\nswitch (action.type) {\n  case GAME_LIST:\n    return{\n      ...state,\n      games : action.payload\n    }\n\n  case GAME_EDIT:\n    \n    return{\n      ...state,\n      games : state.games.map(game =&gt; game._id === action.payload._id ? action.payload : game)\n    }  \n\n  case GAME_CREATE:\n    return{\n      ...state,\n      games : [action.payload, ...state.games]\n    }  \n\n  case GAME_DELETE:\n    return {\n      ...state,\n      games : state.games.filter(game =&gt; game._id != action.payload)\n    }  \n    \n\n  default:\n    return state\n}\n}\n  \n\n\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":660,"question_id":64937627,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I am trying to build a simple algorithm to achieve the best combination of values based on two params in an <code>array</code> of <code>objects</code>.</p>\n<p>The whole code draft is <a href=\"https://codesandbox.io/s/volumetrics-kd9h5?file=/src/App.js\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">here</a></p>\n<p>First I have an <code>array</code> holding <code>objects</code>, the items which will be analyzed and packed into volumes together. All of the values are in <code>percentages</code>.</p>\n<pre><code>const nonStackableItems = [\n    {\n      id: 0,\n      m2: 15,\n      m3: 11,\n      weight: 20\n    },\n    {\n      id: 1,\n      m2: 25,\n      m3: 12,\n      weight: 42\n    },\n    {\n      id: 2,\n      m2: 50,\n      m3: 13,\n      weight: 40\n    },\n    {\n      id: 3,\n      m2: 65,\n      m3: 14,\n      weight: 25\n    }\n  ];\n</code></pre>\n<p>This is the piece of code that does the calculations:</p>\n<p>The idea is to combine these objects into packages, respecting the <code>maximum</code> of <code>100%</code> for each value (except for <code>m3</code> in this case, as all the packages should have enough <code>height</code> in this first analysis).</p>\n<p>So the approach that I gave is just not good enough, as I am sorting this <code>array</code> by <code>m2</code> then by <code>weight</code>, call the <code>function</code> and then compare the length of both, and then choose the result that creates less volumes.</p>\n<pre><code>function nSVolHelper(arr, vol, param1, param2) {\n    let newVol = {\n      id: vol.length,\n      m2: 0,\n      m3: 0,\n      weight: 0\n    };\n    for (let i = 0; i &lt; arr.length; i++) {\n      const validation =\n        newVol[param1] + arr[i][param1] &lt; 100 &amp;&amp;\n        newVol.m2 + arr[i][param2] &lt; 100;\n      if (validation) {\n        newVol.m2 += arr[i].m2;\n        newVol.m3 += arr[i].m3;\n        newVol.weight += arr[i].weight;\n      }\n      if (!validation) {\n        return nSVolHelper(arr.slice(i), [...vol, newVol], param1, param2);\n      }\n    }\n    vol.push(newVol);\n    return vol;\n  }\n\n  function nSVol(arr, param1, param2) {\n    return nSVolHelper(arr, [], param1, param2);\n  }\n</code></pre>\n<p>I would like to find a way of doing this without taking as a base the order of the <code>array</code>, to get the finest calculation without running unnecessary code, without having to run the code ordering the arrays separately, then comparing them. This is not getting the best combination.</p>\n<p>As an example, for better understanding:</p>\n<p>If I pass the array sorted by <code>weight</code> I get a create 2 volumes.</p>\n<pre><code>console.log(\n    &quot;call&quot;,\n    nSVol(\n      nonStackableItems.sort((a, b) =&gt; a.weight - b.weight),\n      &quot;weight&quot;,\n      &quot;m2&quot;\n    )\n</code></pre>\n<p>If I pass this same <code>array</code> sorted by <code>m2</code> I get 3 volumes.</p>\n<pre><code>console.log(\n    &quot;call&quot;,\n    nSVol(\n      nonStackableItems.sort((a, b) =&gt; a.m2 - b.m2),\n      &quot;weight&quot;,\n      &quot;m2&quot;\n    )\n</code></pre>\n<p>Thanks so much in advance.</p>\n<p>Cheers</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":668,"question_id":64937511,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I'm using barba.js with GSAP for page animations and have 4 custom jS files which need to be reinitialised when changing pages. I have this working with the following code, which is fired before the new page renders during the barba.js script execution:</p>\n<pre><code>// Reinitialize Javascript //\nfunction reinitScripts() {\n    // Set Global Variables //\n    var body = document.getElementsByTagName('body')[0];\n    var introParamsScript = document.createElement('script');\n    var parallaxParamsScript = document.createElement('script');\n    var contentScript = document.createElement('script');\n    var videoModalScript = document.createElement('script');\n    // End Set Global Variables //\n    // Set New Script Variables //\n    introParamsScript.src = 'js/introParams.js';\n    parallaxParamsScript.src = 'js/parallaxParams.js';\n    contentScript.src = 'js/content.js';\n    videoModalScript.src = 'js/videoModal.js';\n    // End Set New Script Variables //\n    // Append New Scripts //\n    body.appendChild(introParamsScript);\n    body.appendChild(parallaxParamsScript);\n    body.appendChild(contentScript);\n    body.appendChild(videoModalScript);\n    // End Append New Scripts //\n}\n// End Reinitialize Javascript //\n</code></pre>\n<p>As part of testing this, I have noticed under the elements tab of the developer tools that the scripts are being injected into the body without removing the first instance of the scripts. {"body":"<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/QxMzc.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/QxMzc.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/iuT7D.gif\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/iuT7D.gif\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>I take with <code>useSelector</code> the status of the theme type I need, which I find in<code> settings.item.colorScheme</code>.</p>\n<p>I have a <code>BottomSheet</code> which allows me that clicking on the selected language to change it, this change changes the status of <code>redux</code> so also of <code>settings</code> taken with <code>useSelector</code>.</p>\n<p>The problem is that the state inside the <code>useCallback</code> doesn't change, at least it only changes when the <code>bottomSheet</code> menu is closed and then reopened.</p>\n<p>How can I do that inside what is defined inside <code>useCallback</code> see the updated status?</p>\n<p>I tried to pass it as an argument to the <code>useCallback</code>, but it doesn't work.</p>\n<p>Code:</p>\n<pre><code>  const dispatch = useDispatch();\n  const settings = useSelector((state) =&gt; state.settings);\n  const { present, dismiss } = useBottomSheetModal();\n\n  const theme = [\n    { title: 'Light', value: 'light' },\n    { title: 'Dark', value: 'dark' }\n  ];\n\n  const bottomSheetTheme = useCallback(\n    (newValue, id) =&gt; {\n      present(\n        &lt;View style={{ flex: 1, backgroundColor }}&gt;\n          &lt;Text&gt;{settings.item.colorScheme}&lt;/Text&gt;\n          {theme.map(({ title, value }) =&gt; {\n            return (\n              &lt;TouchableWithoutFeedback\n                key={value}\n                onPress={() =&gt; {"body":"<p>I am trying to create the appearance of typed text using JS. Currently, the <code>output</code> function creates a new DOM element and <code>typeText</code> creates the typing animation.<br>\nHere is the code:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>function typeText(text, outputElement) {\n    var i = 0;\n    var paragText = \"\";\n    var interval = setInterval(function () {\n        paragText += text.charAt(i);\n        outputElement.innerText = paragText;\n        i++;\n        if (text.length == i)\n            clearInterval(interval);\n    }, 70)\n}\nfunction output(text, colour){\n    var outputElement = document.createElement(\"p\");\n    outputElement.setAttribute(\"class\", \"output\");\n    outputElement.setAttribute(\"style\", \"color: \" + colour + \";\");\n    var outputWrapper = document.getElementById(\"output\");\n    outputWrapper.appendChild(outputElement);\n    typeText(text, outputElement);\n}\noutput(\"Test output 1\", \"red\");\noutput(\"Test output 2\", \"green\");\noutput(\"Test output 3\", \"blue\");</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>    &lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n    &lt;html&gt;\n        &lt;head&gt;&lt;/head&gt;\n        &lt;body&gt;\n            &lt;div class = \"output-wrapper\" id = \"output\"&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;/body&gt;\n    &lt;/html&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>When loading the page, all 3 animations happen simultaneously. {"body":"<p>Im actually new to Vue &amp; NuxtJS. Back in school we are actually doing some Vue and NuxtJS and along with the courses, I'm also trying to read the docs in other to learn more.</p>\n<p>While doing some tutorials given by our teacher, there was a functionality named create course and in there there was a select-option tag where we could choose the project category (i.e. Web or Mobile Development) and on reading the docs I read about this best practice of always creating reusable components. Knowing that, I decided to create my custom select-option tag as follows:</p>\n<p><strong>SelectOptions.vue</strong></p>\n<pre><code>&lt;template&gt;\n  &lt;div class=&quot;mb-4&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;div class=&quot;relative&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;select\n        class=&quot;block appearance-none w-full bg-gray-200 border border-gray-200 text-gray-700 py-3 px-4 pr-8 rounded leading-tight focus:outline-none focus:bg-white focus:border-gray-500&quot;\n        :class=&quot;[error ? 'border-red-600 focus:border-red-600' : '']&quot;\n        @change=&quot;change&quot;\n      &gt;\n        &lt;option value=&quot;default&quot;&gt;Select Category&lt;/option&gt;\n        &lt;option\n          v-for=&quot;option in options&quot;\n          :key=&quot;option._id&quot;\n          :value=&quot;option.name&quot;\n          :selected=&quot;selectedOption(option)&quot;\n        &gt;\n          {{ option.name }}\n        &lt;/option&gt;\n      &lt;/select&gt;\n      &lt;div\n        class=&quot;pointer-events-none absolute inset-y-0 right-0 flex items-center px-2 text-gray-700&quot;\n      &gt;\n        &lt;svg\n          class=&quot;fill-current h-4 w-4&quot;\n          xmlns=&quot;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&quot;\n          viewBox=&quot;0 0 20 20&quot;\n        &gt;\n          &lt;path\n            d=&quot;M9.293 12.95l.707.707L15.657 8l-1.414-1.414L10 10.828 5.757 6.586 4.343 8z&quot;\n          /&gt;\n        &lt;/svg&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;span v-if=&quot;error&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;p class=&quot;text-xs italic text-red-600&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;slot&gt;&lt;/slot&gt;\n      &lt;/p&gt;\n    &lt;/span&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/template&gt;\n\n&lt;script&gt;\nexport default {\n  props: [&quot;options&quot;, &quot;value&quot;, &quot;error&quot;],\n  data() {\n    return {\n      selected: null,\n    };\n  },\n  methods: {\n    selectedOption(option) {\n      if (this.value) {\n        return option.name === this.value.name;\n      }\n      return false;\n    },\n    change(e) {\n      const selectedName = e.target.value;\n      const option = this.options.find((option) =&gt; {\n        return selectedName === option.name;\n      });\n      this.$emit(&quot;input&quot;, option);\n    },\n  },\n};\n&lt;/script&gt;\n\n&lt;style&gt;&lt;/style&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>It worked fine I could select the project category and also update my Vuex store. But further in the tutorial the teacher created another select-option tag to update the project status. Like when you click on update, the app loads the project data from the database and you can update it's status from published to active. Here is what was in the tutorial:</p>\n<p>Teacher's select-option tag</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;select\n    :value=&quot;project.status&quot;\n    @input=&quot;($event) =&gt; emitProjectValue($event, 'status')&quot;\n  &gt;\n    &lt;option value=&quot;default&quot;&gt;Change Status&lt;/option&gt;\n    &lt;option value=&quot;active&quot;&gt;Active&lt;/option&gt;\n    &lt;option value=&quot;published&quot;&gt;Published&lt;/option&gt;\n  &lt;/select&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>Seeing that, I first decided to update my component for it to include the possibility to change the project status, and here is how I did it:</p>\n<p><strong>SelectOption.vue (Update)</strong></p>\n<pre><code>&lt;template&gt;\n  &lt;div class=&quot;mb-4&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;div class=&quot;relative&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;select\n        class=&quot;block appearance-none w-full bg-gray-200 border border-gray-200 text-gray-700 py-3 px-4 pr-8 rounded leading-tight focus:outline-none focus:bg-white focus:border-gray-500&quot;\n        :class=&quot;[error ? 'border-red-600 focus:border-red-600' : '']&quot;\n        @change=&quot;change&quot;\n      &gt;\n        &lt;template v-if=&quot;status&quot;&gt;\n          &lt;option value=&quot;default&quot;&gt;Change Status&lt;/option&gt;\n          &lt;option value=&quot;active&quot;&gt;Active&lt;/option&gt;\n          &lt;option value=&quot;published&quot;&gt; Published&lt;/option&gt;\n        &lt;/template&gt;\n        &lt;template v-else&gt;\n          &lt;option value=&quot;default&quot;&gt;Select Category&lt;/option&gt;\n          &lt;option\n            v-for=&quot;option in options&quot;\n            :key=&quot;option._id&quot;\n            :value=&quot;option.name&quot;\n            :selected=&quot;selectedOption(option)&quot;\n            &gt;{{ option.name }}&lt;/option\n          &gt;\n        &lt;/template&gt;\n      &lt;/select&gt;\n      &lt;div\n        class=&quot;pointer-events-none absolute inset-y-0 right-0 flex items-center px-2 text-gray-700&quot;\n      &gt;\n        &lt;svg\n          class=&quot;fill-current h-4 w-4&quot;\n          xmlns=&quot;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&quot;\n          viewBox=&quot;0 0 20 20&quot;\n        &gt;\n          &lt;path\n            d=&quot;M9.293 12.95l.707.707L15.657 8l-1.414-1.414L10 10.828 5.757 6.586 4.343 8z&quot;\n          /&gt;\n        &lt;/svg&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;span v-if=&quot;error&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;p class=&quot;text-xs italic text-red-600&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;slot&gt;&lt;/slot&gt;\n      &lt;/p&gt;\n    &lt;/span&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/template&gt;\n\n&lt;script&gt;\nexport default {\n  props: [&quot;options&quot;, &quot;value&quot;, &quot;error&quot;, &quot;status&quot;],\n  data() {\n    return {\n      selected: null\n    };\n  },\n  methods: {\n    selectedOption(option) {\n      if (this.value) {\n        return option.name === this.value.name;\n      }\n      return false;\n    },\n    change(e) {\n      if (this.status) {\n        this.$emit(&quot;input&quot;, e.target.value);\n      } else {\n        const selectedName = e.target.value;\n        const option = this.options.find(option =&gt; {\n          return selectedName === option.name;\n        });\n        this.$emit(&quot;input&quot;, option);\n      }\n    }\n  }\n};\n&lt;/script&gt;\n\n&lt;style&gt;&lt;/style&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>Having that, I then called my component just like he did:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;SelectOption\n :value=&quot;project.status&quot;\n status=&quot;true&quot;\n @input=&quot;$event =&gt; emitProjectValue($event, 'status')&quot;\n&gt;&lt;/SelectOption&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>In the teacher's tutorial, at the moment he refreshed his page, the select tag showed the current course status that is <code>Published</code> but mine still showed <code>Change Status</code>. But apart from that I was still able to update the store.</p>\n<p>So my questions are how can I refactor my component to have that same effect on refresh on binding the value attribute. And secondly I will be really grateful If you guys could give me some clues or ideas on how to optimize my component.</p>\n<p>Thanks to you all</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":685,"question_id":64937174,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

Please login.&quot;, {\n        theme: &quot;toasted-primary&quot;,\n        position: &quot;top-center&quot;,\n        duration: null,\n        action: {\n          text: &quot;Login&quot;,\n          onClick: (e, toastObject) =&gt; {\n            // CODE HERE TO TRIGGER LOGIN MODAL\n            next(&quot;/&quot;);\n            toastObject.goAway(0);\n          }\n        }\n      });\n      Vue.toasted.hide();\n      next(&quot;/&quot;);\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":687,"question_id":64937098,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
